intro: Phaca speirocarpa, commonly known as the spiral-fruited phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight hairy texture. Phaca speirocarpa is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
